Small settlements can typically support one or two generalist merchants, and larger cities house multiple specialists—experts in one type of product. Merchants range from vendors hustling in the public square to wealthy tycoons running entire commercial organizations. A merchant might have an additional [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) skill about a specific category of item (such as jewelry or magic weapons), with a skill modifier equal to their Mercantile Lore. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 13 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 8 [Merchant](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3412) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 8 **Perception** +6 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) +10, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +12, [Mercantile Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +12, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +8, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +8 **Str** +2 **Dex** +0 **Con** -1 **Int** +2 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +3 **Sales Specialist** For encounters involving negotiation or mercantile skill, a merchant is a 4th-level challenge.
**Appraising Eye** The merchant can use [Mercantile Lore](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=362) to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=2367) about items, including determining their value. They can also attempt to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=2365) using Mercantile Lore and can do so without first knowing whether the item is [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644). **Items** [Club](/Weapons.aspx?ID=2), [Padded Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3) --- **AC** 13 **Fort** +1 **Ref** +2 **Will** +10 **HP** 7 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** club +4, **Damage** 1d6+2 bludgeoning **Melee** fist +4 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+2 bludgeoning **Ranged** club +4 ([thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d6+2 bludgeoning
